name: NYU ITP Data Storytelling
tagline: This is the site for a seven-week Data Storytelling class at NYU
body:
### Welcome to the page for ITPG-GT 2517 001  Data Science Storytelling  

This class meets Wednesday 6:30 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.  (weeks 1-7 only).

* Your instructor is [Hilary Mason](http://hilarymason.com)
* Contact email: me at hilarymason dot com (or hmason at nyu dot edu)
* github repo: https://github.com/hmason/datastorytelling

### Data Storytelling

This short course is an exploration of the line between data analysis and storytelling. How do we find the interesting stories in data, and how do we communicate them in a compelling way, with respect to the data?

### Logistics

We'll be using [github](github.com) to collaborate and share work during this course. Github provides wonderful tools while also reinforcing good software engineering practices.

### Schedule

We have seven short weeks to explore!

**week 0** - Introduction and Philosophy

* philosophy of data science
* introductions
* ipython, github, and a simple analysis
* homework: [get everything installed](http://ipython.org/ipython-doc/stable/install/install.html), work through the bridges and tunnels analysis and commit it to github

**week 1** - Tools and process

 * is [this graph](http://qz.com/122921/the-chart-tim-cook-doesnt-want-you-to-see/) misleading?
 * software engineering process and tools -- how to submit pull requests (and why you would ever want to)
 * a few command-line utilities -- grep, awk, wc
 * a very simple intro to statistics using NYC restaurant health inspection data

**week 2** - Error metrics and process

 * Guest speaker: [Mike Dewar](http://mediaevolution.se/theconference/speaker/mike-dewar/), New York Times R&D
 * Scraping and cleaning data

**week 3** - Markov Chains and art

 * Guest speaker: [Max Shron](http://shron.net/), Data Strategist

**week 4** - Algorithms for Data Exploration

 * Guest speaker: [Gilad Lotan](http://giladlotan.com/), Chief Scientist at Betaworks

**week 5** - Data Product Design

**week 6** - Final project presentations
